intro: Clusia puat, commonly known as the glossy abutilon, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that give it a glossy appearance. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that are often hidden among its foliage. Clusia puat is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in a variety of light conditions. It is also known for its resilience and ability to tolerate urban environments.
